docs.name: Foreman
docs.info: Foreman API v2 is currently the default API version.

apis.short_description: Unregister the host as a subscription consumer
Register a host with subscription and information

params.name: uuid
params.description: UUID to use for registered host, random uuid is generated if not provided

params.name: facts
params.description: Key-value hash of subscription-manager facts, nesting uses a period delimiter (.)

params.name: hypervisor_guest_uuids
params.description: UUIDs of the virtual guests from the host’s hypervisor
params.validator: Must be an array of any type

params.name: installed_products
params.description: List of products installed on the host
params.validator: Must be an Array of nested elements

params.name: product_id
params.description: Product id as listed from a host’s installed products, this is not the same product id as the products api returns

params.name: product_name
params.description: Product name as listed from a host’s installed products

params.name: service_level
params.description: A service level for auto-healing process, e.g. SELF-SUPPORT

params.name: subscriptions
params.validator: Must be an Array of nested elements

params.name: quantity
params.description: If specified, remove the first instance of a subscription with matching id and quantity

apis.short_description: Add a subscription to a host

params.name: subscriptions
params.validator: Must be an Array of nested elements

apis.short_description: Set content overrides for the host

params.name: content_overrides
params.validator: Must be an Array of nested elements

params.name: value
params.description: Override value. Provide a boolean value if name is ‘enabled’

params.name: name
params.description: Override key or name. Note if name is not provided the default name will be ‘enabled’

params.name: remove
params.description: Set true to remove an override and reset it to ‘default’

apis.short_description: Get content and overrides for the host

params.name: content_access_mode_all
params.description: Get all content available, not just that provided by subscriptions

params.name: content_access_mode_env
params.description: Limit content to just that available in the host’s content view version

apis.short_description: Show releases available for the content host
List all hosts for a host group

params.name: thin
params.description: Only list ID and name of hosts

params.name: include
params.description: Array of extra information types to include

params.name: per_page
params.description: Number of results per page to return, ‘all’ to return all results

params.name: location_id
params.description: Set the current location context for the request

params.name: organization_id
params.description: Set the current organization context for the request

params.name: id
params.validator: Must be an identifier, string from 1 to 128 characters containing only alphanumeric characters, dot(.), space, underscore(_), hypen(-) with no leading or trailing space.

params.name: location_id
params.description: Set the current location context for the request

params.name: organization_id
params.description: Set the current organization context for the request

params.name: environment_id
params.description: required if host is managed and value is not inherited from host group

params.name: ip
params.description: not required if using a subnet with DHCP proxy

params.name: mac
params.description: required for managed host that is bare metal, not required if it’s a virtual machine

params.name: architecture_id
params.description: required if host is managed and value is not inherited from host group

params.name: domain_id
params.description: required if host is managed and value is not inherited from host group

params.name: puppetclass_ids
params.validator: Must be an array of any type

params.name: config_group_ids
params.validator: Must be an array of any type

params.name: operatingsystem_id
params.description: required if host is managed and value is not inherited from host group

params.name: medium_id
params.description: required if not imaged based provisioning and host is managed and value is not inherited from host group

params.name: pxe_loader
params.validator: Must be one of: None, PXELinux BIOS, PXELinux UEFI, Grub UEFI, Grub2 BIOS, Grub2 ELF, Grub2 UEFI, Grub2 UEFI SecureBoot, Grub2 UEFI HTTP, Grub2 UEFI HTTPS, Grub2 UEFI HTTPS SecureBoot, iPXE Embedded, iPXE UEFI HTTP, iPXE Chain BIOS, iPXE Chain UEFI.

params.name: ptable_id
params.description: required if host is managed and custom partition has not been defined

params.name: subnet_id
params.description: required if host is managed and value is not inherited from host group

params.name: root_pass
params.description: required if host is managed and value is not inherited from host group or default password in settings

params.name: host_parameters_attributes
params.validator: Must be an Array of nested elements

params.name: provision_method
params.description: The method used to provision the host.

params.name: managed
params.description: True/False flag whether a host is managed or unmanaged. Note: this value also determines whether several parameters are required or not

params.name: progress_report_id
params.description: UUID to track orchestration tasks status, GET /api/orchestration/:UUID/tasks

params.name: interfaces_attributes
params.validator: Must be an Array of nested elements

params.name: mac
params.description: MAC address of interface. Required for managed interfaces on bare metal.

params.name: type
params.description: Interface type, e.g. bmc. Default is interface

params.name: domain_id
params.description: Foreman domain ID of interface. Required for primary interfaces on managed hosts.

params.name: managed
params.description: Should this interface be managed via DHCP and DNS smart proxy and should it be configured during provisioning?

params.name: primary
params.description: Should this interface be used for constructing the FQDN of the host? Each managed hosts needs to have one primary interface.

params.name: provision
params.description: Should this interface be used for TFTP of PXELinux (or SSH for image-based hosts)? Each managed hosts needs to have one provision interface.

params.name: provider
params.description: Interface provider, e.g. IPMI. Only for BMC interfaces.

params.name: tag
params.description: VLAN tag, this attribute has precedence over the subnet VLAN ID. Only for virtual interfaces.

params.name: mtu
params.description: MTU, this attribute has precedence over the subnet MTU.

params.name: attached_to
params.description: Identifier of the interface to which this interface belongs, e.g. eth1. Only for virtual interfaces.

params.name: mode
params.description: Bond mode of the interface, e.g. balance-rr. Only for bond interfaces.

params.name: attached_devices
params.description: Identifiers of attached interfaces, e.g. ['eth1', 'eth2']. For bond interfaces those are the slaves. Only for bond and bridges interfaces.
params.validator: Must be an array of any type

params.name: bond_options
params.description: Space separated options, e.g. miimon=100. Only for bond interfaces.

params.name: compute_attributes
params.description: Additional compute resource specific attributes for the interface.

params.name: kickstart_repository_id
params.description: Repository Id associated with the kickstart repo used for provisioning

params.name: release_version
params.description: Release version for this Host to use (7Server, 7.1, etc)

params.name: autoheal
params.description: Sets whether the Host will autoheal subscriptions upon checkin

params.name: purpose_addons
params.validator: Must be an array of any type

params.name: service_level
params.description: Service level to be used for autoheal

params.validator: Must be an array of any type

params.name: ip
params.description: IPv4 address, not required if using a subnet with DHCP proxy

params.name: ip6
params.description: IPv6 address, not required if using a subnet with DHCP proxy

params.name: mac
params.description: required for managed host that is bare metal, not required if it’s a virtual machine

params.name: domain_id
params.description: required if host is managed and value is not inherited from host group

params.name: operatingsystem_id
params.description: required if host is managed and value is not inherited from host group

params.name: subnet_id
params.description: required if host is managed and value is not inherited from host group

params.name: host_parameters_attributes
params.validator: Must be an Array of nested elements

params.name: managed
params.description: True/False flag whether a host is managed or unmanaged. Note: this value also determines whether several parameters are required or not

params.name: interfaces_attributes
params.validator: Must be an Array of nested elements

params.name: mac
params.description: MAC address of interface. Required for managed interfaces on bare metal.

params.name: type
params.description: Interface type, e.g. bmc. Default is interface

params.name: domain_id
params.description: Foreman domain ID of interface. Required for primary interfaces on managed hosts.

params.name: managed
params.description: Should this interface be managed via DHCP and DNS smart proxy and should it be configured during provisioning?

params.name: primary
params.description: Should this interface be used for constructing the FQDN of the host? Each managed hosts needs to have one primary interface.

params.name: provision
params.description: Should this interface be used for TFTP of PXELinux (or SSH for image-based hosts)? Each managed hosts needs to have one provision interface.

params.name: provider
params.description: Interface provider, e.g. IPMI. Only for BMC interfaces.

params.name: tag
params.description: VLAN tag, this attribute has precedence over the subnet VLAN ID. Only for virtual interfaces.

params.name: mtu
params.description: MTU, this attribute has precedence over the subnet MTU.

params.name: attached_to
params.description: Identifier of the interface to which this interface belongs, e.g. eth1. Only for virtual interfaces.

params.name: mode
params.description: Bond mode of the interface, e.g. balance-rr. Only for bond interfaces.

params.name: attached_devices
params.description: Identifiers of attached interfaces, e.g. ['eth1', 'eth2']. For bond interfaces those are the slaves. Only for bond and bridges interfaces.
params.validator: Must be an array of any type

params.name: bond_options
params.description: Space separated options, e.g. miimon=100. Only for bond interfaces.

params.name: compute_attributes
params.description: Additional compute resource specific attributes for the interface.

params.name: kickstart_repository_id
params.description: Repository Id associated with the kickstart repo used for provisioning

params.name: release_version
params.description: Release version for this Host to use (7Server, 7.1, etc)

params.name: autoheal
params.description: Sets whether the Host will autoheal subscriptions upon checkin

params.name: purpose_addons
params.validator: Must be an array of any type

params.name: service_level
params.description: Service level to be used for autoheal

params.name: hypervisor_guest_uuids
params.validator: Must be an array of any type

params.name: installed_products_attributes
params.description: List of products installed on the host
params.validator: Must be an Array of nested elements

params.name: product_id
params.description: Product id as listed from a host’s installed products, this is not the same product id as the products api returns

params.name: product_name
params.description: Product name as listed from a host’s installed products

params.name: setup_insights
params.description: Set ‘host_registration_insights’ parameter for the host. If it is set to true, insights client will be installed and registered on Red Hat family operating systems.

params.name: setup_remote_execution
params.description: Set ‘host_registration_remote_execution’ parameter for the host. If it is set to true, SSH keys will be installed on the host.

params.name: remote_execution_interface
params.description: Identifier of the Host interface for Remote execution

domains.name: Domains
domains.full_description: Foreman considers a domain and a DNS zone as the same thing. That is, if you are planning to manage a site where all the machines are of the form hostname.somewhere.com then the domain is somewhere.com. This allows Foreman to associate a puppet variable with a domain/site and automatically append this variable to all external node requests made by machines at that site.

for example http://mirror.centos.org/centos/$version/os/$arch where $arch will be substituted for the host’s actual OS architecture and $version, $major and $minor will be substituted for the version of the operating system.

Solaris and Debian media may also use $release.

methods.name: bulk_search
methods.full_description: For every search it returns the list of tasks that satisfty the condition. The reason for supporting multiple searches is the UI that might be ending needing periodic updates on task status for various searches at the same time. This way, it is possible to get all the task statuses with one request.

lifecycle_environments.name: Lifecycle environments
lifecycle_environments.full_description:
Description

An environment is a basic organization structure that groups hosts, products, repositories, etc. Every host belongs to one environment and it’s isolated inside so that it can see only content that is in its environment.

Chains

Environments are ordered into chains and their content (products, repositories, tempaltes, packages) can be moved to an environment only from its prior environment. You can have for example chain like:

Library -> Development -> Testing -> Production

Each change in an environment is done through a changeset in an action called promotion.

Library

Library is a special environment that has no ascendant: All the content starts in this environment. More chains can start from the library environment but no further branching of a chain is enabled.
